tile.text:
The guard chuckles, "You think you're an elf or something? Bows are versatile but they're hard to use effectively. Accuracy is difficult under pressure and arrows aren't much use once someone is near enough to hit you with something. Course the trick is getting them before they make it that close. Well what are you waiting for? Lets get to work.
He finds a bow and free target and the two of you get to it. When you start the sun is high in the sky, you do not stop until the sun is well below the horizon and the practice yard lit only by flickering torches. You are so exhausted you simply collapse on a spare bedroll in the guards nearby tent. The next morning you thank him for the crash course in bow use and prepare for the next stage of your journey, before you can leave the guard surprises you. Without explanation he pushes a bow and quiver of arrows into your hands before striding off towards his post.

link.text: Feeling satisfied with your progress, you retrace your steps towards the center of the town.
